Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.concurrent

Class JUnitExecutor<Command,​Response>

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.concurrent.JUnitExecutor<Command,​Response>
Type Parameters:
Command - any type to use as a "command"
Response - any type to use as a "response"
public class JUnitExecutor<Command,​Response>
extends java.lang.Object

This class is especially used inside JUnit tests to test multi-threaded components. It supports interaction between two Thread instances and strongly synchronized their rendezvou points. Typical scenario to use this class is:

  • master thread starts slave thread and sends the JUnitExecutor instance to it. The only action in the slave thread is to call waitCommand(CommandProcessor) method on it
  • master thread calls execute(Object, long, Object...) method to send any command to the slave one.
  • slave thread executes callback passed in the waitCommand(CommandProcessor)
  • master thread calls getResponse(long) to take response from the slave thread and test it

Both of the execute(Object, long, Object...) and getResponse(long) can be interrupted by Thread.interrupt() call and by timeout. It's guaranteed, that return from execute(Object, long, Object...) method in the master is exactly before call waitCommand(CommandProcessor) method callback in the slave. It's guaranteed, that return from getResponse(long) method in the master are exactly after return from waitCommand(CommandProcessor) method callback in the slave.

If any exception has been thrown in the waitCommand(CommandProcessor) method callback, it fires DebuggingException in getResponse(long) method call. Method Throwable.getCause() can be used to get source exception from the waitCommand(CommandProcessor) method callback.

Example to use this class see JUnit test case for it.

Since:
0.0.3
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961

      public JUnitExecutor()

    • JUnitExecutor

      public JUnitExecutor​(boolean trace)

      Constructor of the class

      Parameters:
      trace - turn on debugging trace while test execution. Use this parameter to find problems in your JUnit test only

  • Method Details

    • waitCommand

      public void waitCommand​(JUnitExecutor.CommandProcessor<Command,​Response> proc) throws java.lang.InterruptedException, java.lang.NullPointerException

      This call must be used in the slave thread to get commands from the master one.

      Parameters:
      proc - callback to process commands
      Throws:
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the slave thread was interrupted
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when callback is null

    • execute

      public boolean execute​(Command command, long timeoutMillis, java.lang.Object... parameters) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      Send command and parameters to slave thread.

      Parameters:
      command - any instance to identify command
      timeoutMillis - timeout to execute method
      parameters - additional parameters for the command
      Returns:
      true if command was successfully sent to the slave thread, false otherwise
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when command instance is null
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when timeout is zero or negative

    • hasResponse

      public boolean hasResponse()

      Has response form the slave thread

      Returns:
      true if yes

    • getResponse

      public Response getResponse​(long timeoutMillis) throws DebuggingException, java.lang.InterruptedException, java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      Get response form the slave thread

      Parameters:
      timeoutMillis - timeout to wait response
      Returns:
      response instance from the slave thread
      Throws:
      DebuggingException - when the save thread threw exception during callback processing
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the master treads interrupts
      java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when timeout is zero or negative

    • call

      public Response call​(Command cmd, java.lang.Object... parameters) throws DebuggingException, java.lang.InterruptedException, java.lang.NullPointerException

      Synchronously call slave thread with the command and return it's response

      Parameters:
      cmd - any instance to identify command
      parameters - additional parameters for the command
      Returns:
      response instance
      Throws:
      DebuggingException - when the save thread threw exception during callback processing
      java.lang.InterruptedException - when the master treads interrupts
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when command instance is null
